page.title: 19PRUDHOE HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: The school opened on April 15 1958 and accommodated 429 pupils and 19 staff. By 1979 there were 621 pupils and 27 staff. It opened as a Secondary Modern School, but in 1977 it became a High School. Since the school opened it has had many additions e.g. the Sixth Form Block, Sports Hall and a Youth Block. In 1985 there are 870 pupils and 54 staff. The school overlooks the Tyne Valley and many of the local farms and villages surrounding it.The catchment area includes the villages of Wylam, Ovingham, Ovington, Stocksfield, Mickley and the town of Prudhoe. Pupils who attend the High School come from Eastwood, Highfield and Ovingham Middle Schools. All of these schools were involved in the collection of data for the Domesday Project.
